intro: Centaurium scilloides var. portense, commonly known as the purple centaury, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, bright purple flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
